Articles.Content:
After fretting about no MK2 Cargo bays (besides the one in bae) I decided to make one.

I do need a texturer as these photos show.

Very nice! And useful indeed.

I think I could texture it for you, shouldn't take long.
That looks very useful indeed, and there will be no need to download 100 megaton B9 mod!
Oh yes I was looking for this specific part for a long time, how is going development? ( also the mk3 version would be great )

That looks very useful indeed, and there will be no need to download 100 megaton B9 mod!

you know, you can just take out all the parts you don't want to use, and leave the ones you do want to use.
An Mk2 and Mk3 Cargo bay mod would be a nice little add-on.
But... There already are MK3 Cargo Bays! Just in case somebody didn't know- MK3 Expansion pack

Ah that is interesting Absolute Human, thanks for pointiing it out, I'll try it

UPDATE: that mk3 expansion pack is very nice is just what I had in mind and even further , too bad that is not updated anymore ( you need to add the part {} in .cfg files not all parts are updated to new ksp format ). And for rasheed mk2 version why not using the stock texture? I am trying to make the mk2 myself right now I am just learning how blender works

Edited February 14, 2014 by brusura

Matched the under tiles i guess to the stock. And a small thing out of place.

What is wrong with this photo

What is wrong with this photo

A lot. For starters, you're propelling the plane with rockets. The cargo bay is open. Your rear landing gear pods are about as aerodynamic as a serving platter a a nosecone. Lastly, the side edges of the bay do not match stock black.

Did I get it all?
Did you notice the Engine FX not being in the stock nor the hotrockets?
